references.paper_title: Out of One, Many: Using Language Models to Simulate Human Samples
references.reason: This paper introduces a novel method for simulating human samples using language models, a technique directly relevant to the paper's LLM-based evaluation agent.

references.paper_title: Interactive question answering systems: Literature review
references.reason: This paper provides a comprehensive overview of interactive question answering systems, which is the focus of the current paper's evaluation framework.
This seminal paper demonstrates the capabilities of LLMs as few-shot learners, a foundational concept for the current work's LLM-based evaluation agents.

references.paper_title: Modeling personalization in continuous space for response generation via augmented wasserstein autoencoders
references.reason: This paper explores personalization in dialogue systems using persona-based models, a technique directly applied to the current paper's LLM-based agents with personas.
This paper introduces the QuAC dataset, a benchmark for question answering in context, which serves as a basis for the experimental setup of the current paper
